Childhood favorite game never will give it up no matter what.

I love TF2 and I have zero regrets about wasting hundreds of hours in a game thats older than a quarter of its playerbase. But I seriously cant recommend picking the game up fresh at this point. Valve STILL refuses to budge on the bot crisis making the casual servers nearly unplayable at certain times of day and fairly unpleasant at all times. And now as a free to play you will be stripped of all communications and ability to work functionally with a team, because for some reason Valve decided that beating free to plays was an acceptable "fix" for bots the one time they actually did anything.
You already know that this game is good, so أتمنى أن تقوم بتثبيت هذه اللعبة وأن تحصل على الكثير من المرح. هذا هو أعظم مطلق النار على أساس الفصل ، لذا تحقق منه.

Team Fortress 2 will forever hold a very special place in my heart. While I started playing after Jungle Inferno, well after the best content had come and gone, I have still had a blast. To say nothing of its current state, at its core, this game is phenomenal, and always will be. Do have to say though, a part of me will always resent Valve for introducing an economy. lol

dude just play it its free

When tf2 came out, I couldn't play it. I didn't have a pc, nor was I born. on my old toaster pc, I played this game against bots all the time trying to get better, than playing online more and more. Now, I play online all the time like you are supposed to and think that this game is a masterpiece. Most games will not last as long as this one, but tf2 has lasted nearly 20 years. Every class has different gimmicks and strategies, that make them super unique and fun to play. Every gun that you can unlock feels balanced. Unlike some games, that make some guns just better and better. But in tf2, there aren't bad guns. There are guns that will change something for the better, but also something for the worse. For example the class "Heavy" has a minigun that does more damage but is very slow. There are lots of game modes to play and lots of classes to master.

I played this one back in 07. It was strange but it did have the multiplayer component in The Orange Box. I only played it a few times and left it alone after Halo 3 took over everybody's 360. Now I can't stop playing this on PC. It feels so much better than before! Playing through this game is really special in a way because The Orange Box was my second favorite game of that year and how boy has it been a blast playing against some pretty entertaining teammates. Anyone who uses STEAM should really try it themselves and hopefully can have as much fun as I am. Being free to play is also a major plus.

Team Fortress 2 is one of my favorite games of all-time.

However, I cannot recommend it in good faith anymore in 2021. Especially after the game has been neglected by Valve for so long and how deafening their silence has been on a lot of core issues regarding the game - and I am not just talking about the absurd cheating problem - I cannot, in good faith, recommend it anymore.

Team Fortress 2 was released in 2007 and to say it revolutionized class-based first person shooters would be a massive understatement. Hell, I'd say it was a bold-faced lie. For years after it was released it was nurtured and loved by Valve, with updates helping to further along the game's core concept and add amazing new additions, like Payload in 2008 and Mann vs. Machine in 2012.

One day everything just stopped. TF2 stopped being updated. Valve seemingly had moved on from it. Nowadays, every so often, we get a minor update or a minor tournament announcement on the official blog and that's about it. Update droughts spanning months (or [i]years[/i] if major updates are what you're thinking) are unfortunately way too common. You can use the shoddy Competitive Mode as an example of this. Added in 2016 during the highly-controversial "Meet Your Match" update, improved upon with a better ranking system in 2018 during an unnamed patch (the fans call it the "Blue Moon Update" due to the Blue Moon Cosmetic Case being added that update) and then...that's it. No updates whatsoever since then. No lifting graphical restrictions, no class limits, no map pool rotations - nothing.

Same thing happened with stuff like the ConTracker - an amazing idea that was executed very well and then...abandoned. It showed so much promise yet Valve threw it under the bus entirely.

The community's doing its best to keep this game alive and kicking, with projects like CreatorsTF and just big YouTubers choosing to host their own vanilla TF2 servers rather than play on the radioactive wasteland known as Casual Mode, and honestly that's how I play TF2 nowadays myself - I go to community servers and stick around there for a while.

It's so sad to see one of my favorite games of all-time being treated and abandoned like cattle. Team Fortress 2 doesn't deserve the way it's being treated right now, but until that changes - my advice would be to stay away. Stay away until Valve shows they actually care about the game itself and continue to nurture and expand upon it. TF2 has so much room to grow, so much untapped potential that it hurts to play it sometimes.
